meanings.sent1: After a long period of feeling disconnected, she started respiritualizing her life by attending meditation classes.
meanings.sent2: The community came together to respiritualize the old church, turning it into a place of peace and reflection.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he needed to respiritualize his morning routine by actually waking up before noon.
meanings.sent4: The retreat in the mountains was a perfect opportunity for her to respiritualize her soul and find inner peace.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the ocean waves helped respiritualize her mind and bring a sense of calm.

meanings.definition: To bring back a sense of spirituality.
meanings.sent1: The music festival aimed to respiritualize the attendees through soulful performances and inspiring talks.
meanings.sent2: Traveling to different countries always had a way of respiritualizing her and connecting her to the world.
meanings.sent3: She decided to respiritualize her daily routine by adding moments of gratitude and reflection.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins had a mystical aura that seemed to respiritualize all who visited.
meanings.sent5: The simple act of gardening helped respiritualize his connection to nature and the earth.

meanings.definition: The act of reinvigorating one's spiritual beliefs.
meanings.sent1: Her respiritualizing of her faith brought her a sense of peace and purpose.
meanings.sent2: The retreat was a powerful respiritualizing experience that left everyone feeling renewed.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's take on respiritualizing spirituality had the audience laughing and reflecting at the same time.
meanings.sent4: The respiritualizing of the old temple turned it into a place of pilgrimage and contemplation.
meanings.sent5: The respiritualizing of the community's traditions brought a sense of unity and connection among its members.
